getLabel

java.lang.String getLabel(org.openrdf.model.Value res)
Convert a resource into a nice name which can be displayed on the UI, uses internal caching mechanism. If available, uses the rdf:label, if URI use the URI local name, else simply toString for literals, just return the literal itself.

getLabelHTMLEncoded

java.lang.String getLabelHTMLEncoded(org.openrdf.model.Value res)
Convert a resource into a nice name which can be displayed on the UI, uses internal caching mechanism. If available, uses the rdf:label, if URI use the URI local name, else simply toString for literals, just return the literal itself. The returned string is HTML-encoded, i.e. ready for use in the UI; if you need an unencoded String, call getLabel(Value) instead.

getPropertyInfo

PropertyCache.PropertyInfo getPropertyInfo(org.openrdf.model.URI property)
Gets ontology-defined information for the given predicate, such as dom and range information. Uses internal caching mechanism.

getInverseProp

org.openrdf.model.URI getInverseProp(org.openrdf.model.URI prop)
Returns the inverse property using a cache. If no inverse property is defined, null is returned.

getInverseProp

org.openrdf.model.URI getInverseProp(org.openrdf.model.URI prop,
                                     boolean refreshCacheBeforeLookup)
Returns the inverse property using a cache. If no inverse property is defined, null is returned. The cache is invalidated before lookup.

lookupURIfromName

org.openrdf.model.URI lookupURIfromName(java.lang.String name)
This method checks if a resource with a given label already exists, if yes, we just use the first one It thus performs a best match based on existing data. (If no match is found, null is returned) This may later be extended to find the best matching resource based on more complex heuristics, similarly as OKKAM does it. http://www.okkam.org/

Returns:

prepareQuery

org.openrdf.query.Query prepareQuery(java.lang.String query,
                                     boolean resolveNamespaces,
                                     org.openrdf.model.Value resolveValue,
                                     boolean infer)
                                     throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException,
                                            org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                                            java.lang.IllegalAccessException
Prepares a SPARQL query on the DataManager's connection. Namespace prefixes used in the query are resolved using the namespaces that are currently registered with the namespace service. In addition, the pattern "??" is replaced by the URI given by resolveURI, and $user$ are replaced by the user URI. Query timeout is set as defined by Config#queryTimeout This method allows to create Tuple, Graph and Boolean queries, i.e. all kinds of update queries are explicitly forbidden. In such case an IllegalAccessException is thrown.

Parameters:
query - a valid SPARQL query
resolveNamespaces - flag to enable resolution of namespace prefixes in the query
resolveValue - the value to use for "??" in the query, can be null
infer - boolean flag to indicate inference
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the query type is not allowed
org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException

sparqlAsk

boolean sparqlAsk(java.lang.String query,
                  boolean resolveNamespaces,
                  org.openrdf.model.Value resolveValue,
                  boolean infer)
                  throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException,
                         org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                         org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException
Evaluates a SPARQL ASK query on the DataManager's connection and returns the result in form of a boolean. Namespace prefixes used in the query are resolved using the namespaces that are currently registered with the namespace service, if enabled. Inferencing is enabled as configured.

Throws:
org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException

sparqlConstruct

org.openrdf.query.GraphQueryResult sparqlConstruct(java.lang.String query)
                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
Returns the graph returned by a SPARQL CONSTRUCT query. No inferencing is applied.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

sparqlConstruct

org.openrdf.query.GraphQueryResult sparqlConstruct(java.lang.String query,
                                                   boolean resolveNamespaces,
                                                   org.openrdf.model.Value resolveValue,
                                                   boolean infer)
                                                   throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException,
                                                          org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                                                          org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException
Evaluates a SPARQL CONSTRUCT query on the DataManager's connection and returns the result in form of a GraphQueryResult. Namespace prefixes used in the query are resolved using the namespaces that are currently registered with the namespace service. In addition, the pattern "??" is replaced by the URI given by resolveURI. infer determines whether inferencing should be applied or not.

Throws:
org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException

sparqlConstruct

org.openrdf.query.GraphQueryResult sparqlConstruct(java.lang.String query,
                                                   boolean resolveNamespaces)
                                                   throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException,
                                                          org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                                                          org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException
Evaluates a SPARQL CONSTRUCT query on the DataManager's connection and returns the result in form of a GraphQueryResult. Namespace prefixes used in the query are resolved using the namespaces that are currently registered with the namespace service. No inferencing is applied.

Throws:
org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException

sparqlSelect

org.openrdf.query.TupleQueryResult sparqlSelect(java.lang.String query)
                                                throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                                                       org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException
Evaluates a SPARQL SELECT query on the DataManager's connection and returns the result in form of a TupleQueryResult. The query is expected to contain no prefixed namespaces, if so an error will be thrown. Inferencing depends on Config#getInferencing

Parameters:
query - a valid SPARQL query
Throws:
org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException

sparqlSelect

org.openrdf.query.TupleQueryResult sparqlSelect(java.lang.String query,
                                                boolean resolveNamespaces)
                                                throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                                                       org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException
Evaluates a SPARQL SELECT query on the DataManager's connection and returns the result in form of a TupleQueryResult. Namespace prefixes used in the query are resolved using the namespaces that are currently registered with the namespace service. No inferencing is applied.

Parameters:
query - a valid SPARQL query
resolveNamespaces - flag to enable resolution of namespace prefixes in the query
Throws:
org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException

sparqlSelect

org.openrdf.query.TupleQueryResult sparqlSelect(java.lang.String query,
                                                boolean resolveNamespaces,
                                                org.openrdf.model.Value resolveValue,
                                                boolean infer)
                                                throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                                                       org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException
Evaluates a SPARQL SELECT query on the DataManager's connection and returns the result in form of a TupleQueryResult. Namespace prefixes used in the query are resolved using the namespaces that are currently registered with the namespace service. In addition, the pattern "??" is replaced by the URI given by resolveURI, $user$ is replaced by the user URI. infer determines whether inferencing should be applied or not.

Throws:
org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException

sparqlSelect

org.openrdf.query.TupleQueryResult sparqlSelect(java.lang.String query,
                                                boolean resolveNamespaces,
                                                org.openrdf.model.Value resolveValue,
                                                boolean resolveUser,
                                                boolean infer)
                                                throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                                                       org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException
Evaluates a SPARQL SELECT query on the DataManager's connection and returns the result in form of a TupleQueryResult. Namespace prefixes used in the query are resolved using the namespaces that are currently registered with the namespace service. In addition, the pattern "??" is replaced by the URI given by resolveURI. resolveUser determines whether the variable $user$ in the query is replaced by the user URI. infer determines whether inferencing should be applied or not.

Throws:
org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException

                                                        boolean infer)
                                                        throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                                                               org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException
Evaluates a SPARQL SELECT query on the DataManager's connection and returns the result in form of a Java ObjectTable. Namespace prefixes used in the query are resolved using the namespaces that are currently registered with the namespace service. In addition, the pattern "??" is replaced by the URI given by resolveURI. infer determines whether inferencing should be applied or not.

aggregateQueryResultWrtUnknownDatasets

java.util.Map<org.openrdf.model.Value,java.util.Vector<java.lang.Number>> aggregateQueryResultWrtUnknownDatasets(org.openrdf.query.TupleQueryResult result,
                                                                                                                 ReadDataManager.AggregationType aggType,
                                                                                                                 java.lang.String input,
                                                                                                                 java.lang.String output,
                                                                                                                 java.util.List<org.openrdf.model.Value> datasets)
                                                                                                                 throws org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException
Constructs a two dimensional result via aggregation over a SPARQL query result. Extracts the dataset names as values of the output variable to group the result by these values before aggregating. The list of given datasets is empty and will be filled with the datasets names by the ReadDataManager.

Throws:
org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException

                                                                                                          java.lang.String input,
                                                                                                          java.lang.String output,
                                                                                                          java.lang.String[] datasetStrings)
                                                                                                          throws org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException
Constructs a two dimensional result via aggregation over a SPARQL query result. Uses datasetStrings to group the result by values of variable ?dataset before aggregating.

org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException

isEditable

boolean isEditable(org.openrdf.model.URI predicate)
In the ontology, we annotate whether the user should be able to edit certain predicates or not Default is editable = true

Parameters:
predicate - The name of the predicate
Returns:
whether the predicate is editable

guessValueForPredicate

org.openrdf.model.Value guessValueForPredicate(java.lang.String name,
                                               org.openrdf.model.URI predicate,
                                               boolean preferURI)
The requested subject may be either - a local name in the default namespace, - a prefixed URI, or - a literal. The method uses range information for the given predicate as well as namespace information to distinguish between these three types. Via perferURI it can be specified whether (in case of no schema information) preferably a URI should be returned instead of a literal

guessValueForPredicate

org.openrdf.model.Value guessValueForPredicate(java.lang.String name,
                                               org.openrdf.model.URI predicate)
Guesses a value (see above), preferring literals over URIs

createLiteralForPredicate

org.openrdf.model.Literal createLiteralForPredicate(java.lang.String name,
                                                    org.openrdf.model.URI predicate)
Creates a literal whose type is determined by the schema definition of the predicate If no range is defined for the predicate, the literal will be untyped If the range is not a datatype, the literal will also be untyped

getPath

org.openrdf.model.Resource getPath(org.openrdf.model.Resource subject,
                                   java.lang.String path)
simple query language for traversing the RDF graph starting from subject, the path p1/p2 returns object where: s-p1-X, X-p2-object starting from subject, the path p1/inversep2 returns subject where: s-p1-X, subject-p2-X

Parameters:
subject - the subject to start from
path - the query path
Returns:

                                                    throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
Returns the context URIs using RepositoryConnection#getContextIDs(). Implementation returns URIs only, i.e. BNodes are ignored

Returns:
Throws:
org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException

getContext

Context getContext(org.openrdf.model.URI contextURI,
                   boolean refreshCacheBeforeLookup)
Returns the contexts associated to the given URI in the given repository using the cache. The refresh parameter can be used to enforce cache refresh; it everything is working fine, it should not be used (which means, if we do not forget to trigger cache refresh when data is updated). Method also updates the cache, i.e. stores the element if it is missing.

getContext

Context getContext(org.openrdf.model.URI contextURI)
Returns the meta information for the given context in the given repository using the cache. No refresh is enforced (it should not be necessary, though, so this is probably the method you want to use). Method also updates the cache, i.e. stores the element if it is missing.

resourceExists

boolean resourceExists(org.openrdf.model.URI resource)
Checks if the resource exists in the database in the subject position of some triple.

                                       java.lang.String preferredLanguage)
Searches for values for a set of outgoing properties for the passed value. The properties are evaluated in list order. Additionally, takes a preferred language tag.
